carousel_items: Don't use Ketorolac eye drops while wearing contact lenses.
Ketorolac eye drops can harm babies, so don't use them during late pregnancy.
Following eye surgery, the recommended dose is one drop four times a day for up to 4 days.
Can be used with other eye medications.
Wash your hands before and after using this medication.

basics.benefits_moa: Ketorolac eye drops are nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory eye drops. They stop your body from making chemicals that cause inflammation and pain in your eye.
basics.bottom_line: Ketorolac eye drops are a good choice, especially if you're recovering from eye surgery.
downsides: If there's a scratch or cut on your eye, Ketorolac eye drops will slow down the healing process.
Can't be used in children 3 years or younger.
The most frequent side effects are stinging and burning.

downsides_processed.orig: If there's a scratch or cut on your eye, Ketorolac eye drops will slow down the healing process.
Can't be used in children 3 years or younger.
The most frequent side effects are stinging and burning.

upsides: Ketorolac eye drops don't affect the pressure inside of your eye.
Side effects shouldn't last more than a few minutes.
The medication isn't absorbed into the rest of your body, so its effects are limited to the eye.

upsides_processed.orig: Ketorolac eye drops don't affect the pressure inside of your eye.
Side effects shouldn't last more than a few minutes.
The medication isn't absorbed into the rest of your body, so its effects are limited to the eye.

carousel_items: Opioid pain medicine that provides longer pain relief—up to 12 hours.
Works best when taken regularly instead of as-needed.
Especially useful for people with chronic pain problems.
May not be the best choice for people who have never taken an opioid pain medicine because it lasts so long.
Swallow it whole. Don't crush, chew, or split the medicine.
Can make you dizzy or drowsy.
Avoid activities that need you to be fully alert until you know how it affects you.
Take it with food to lower the chance of an upset stomach.
Constipation is common and may not go away while you're taking this medicine. Drinking lots of water and taking laxatives can help.
Talk to your doctor if it doesn't help enough for your pain, or if the side effects are really bad.

clock.tip: Take with food or milk to lower stomach upset.

basics.benefits_moa: Morphine is an opioid medicine that works in the brain to lower pain perception.
basics.bottom_line: Morphine provides good long-term pain control without the need to take medicine frequently, but watch out for constipation.
downsides: Doesn't work for as-needed or quick pain relief.
Dizziness and drowsiness is common, but your body may adjust.
Everyone will get constipation - always stay hydrated and take stool softener or stimulant on days you're taking Morphine if you need.
Long term use will likely cause physical dependence.
Must be weaned slowly off the medicine after use longer than 2 weeks.

downsides_processed.orig: Doesn't work for as-needed or quick pain relief.
Dizziness and drowsiness is common, but your body may adjust.
Everyone will get constipation - always stay hydrated and take stool softener or stimulant on days you're taking Morphine if you need.
Long term use will likely cause physical dependence.
Must be weaned slowly off the medicine after use longer than 2 weeks.

upsides: Provides longer relieve for moderate to severe pain to improve quality of life.
Good for chronic pain that requires around-the-clock relief.
Might have fewer side effects than other opioid pain relievers.

upsides_processed.orig: Provides longer relieve for moderate to severe pain to improve quality of life.
Good for chronic pain that requires around-the-clock relief.
Might have fewer side effects than other opioid pain relievers.

userStories.identifier: I have severe and advance DDD
userStories.tip: Causes dry mouth which can cause problems with dental decay even if you never had a problem before.  Keep up dental cleaning at your dentist and use things like sugarless gum after eating if you can not brush your teeth right away..

drugs.name: Morphine sulfate

carousel_items_processed.orig: Opioid pain medicine that provides longer pain relief—up to 12 hours.
Works best when taken regularly instead of as-needed.
Especially useful for people with chronic pain problems.
May not be the best choice for people who have never taken an opioid pain medicine because it lasts so long.
Swallow it whole. Don't crush, chew, or split the medicine.
Can make you dizzy or drowsy.
Avoid activities that need you to be fully alert until you know how it affects you.
Take it with food to lower the chance of an upset stomach.
Constipation is common and may not go away while you're taking this medicine. Drinking lots of water and taking laxatives can help.
Talk to your doctor if it doesn't help enough for your pain, or if the side effects are really bad.

risks_warnings.title: Death from lack of oxygen to the body (respiratory depression)
risks_warnings.description: Taking too much Morphine can cause irregular or slow breathing that can put you in a coma and can cause death. Morphine should be swallowed whole, don't ever crush or chew. If your lips and fingers start turning blue from low oxygen, see a doctor immediately. In the hospital, doctors can give you a medicine that reverses the effects of Morphine. Don't take more than your doctor prescribes. Always check with your doctor before starting any new medicines or supplements.
risk_factors: Current use of medicine that affects liver enzyme CYP 3A4
People with not enough thyroid hormones

description_processed.orig: Taking too much Morphine can cause irregular or slow breathing that can put you in a coma and can cause death. Morphine should be swallowed whole, don't ever crush or chew. If your lips and fingers start turning blue from low oxygen, see a doctor immediately. In the hospital, doctors can give you a medicine that reverses the effects of Morphine. Don't take more than your doctor prescribes. Always check with your doctor before starting any new medicines or supplements.

risks_warnings.title: Death from overdose
risks_warnings.description: Even 1 dose of Morphine can be too much for children. Keep the medicine out of reach from children. If you suspect your child has taken Morphine, watch for decreased activity, extreme tiredness, and lips and fingers turning blue from low oxygen. Go to a hospital immediately and the doctors can give a medicine that reverses the effects of Morphine until the effects wear off.

description_processed.orig: Even 1 dose of Morphine can be too much for children. Keep the medicine out of reach from children. If you suspect your child has taken Morphine, watch for decreased activity, extreme tiredness, and lips and fingers turning blue from low oxygen. Go to a hospital immediately and the doctors can give a medicine that reverses the effects of Morphine until the effects wear off.

risks_warnings.title: Death in newborn babies from opioid withdrawal (Neonatal opioid withdrawal syndrome)
risks_warnings.description: Let your doctor know if you have used Morphine during pregnancy. Your baby may need special care after birth from experts in this area.

description_processed.orig: Let your doctor know if you have used Morphine during pregnancy. Your baby may need special care after birth from experts in this area.

risks_warnings.title: Tolerance, dependence, and addiction
risks_warnings.description: Extended-release and long-acting opioid pain relievers like Morphine have a greater risk of addiction, abuse, misuse, overdose, and death. Your body can develop tolerance to Morphine, which means that more medicine is needed to treat the same pain. You may become physically dependent on Morphine if you have been using it continuously for 2-3 weeks or longer, which means that you'll feel withdrawal symptoms if you stop taking it. You can avoid withdrawal by weaning off of the medication very slowly with the help of a doctor. Take only the prescribed dose. People with a history of drug abuse shouldn't take Morphine if an alternative medicine is available.
risk_factors: Taking more than the prescribed dose

description_processed.orig: Extended-release and long-acting opioid pain relievers like Morphine have a greater risk of addiction, abuse, misuse, overdose, and death. Your body can develop tolerance to Morphine, which means that more medicine is needed to treat the same pain. You may become physically dependent on Morphine if you have been using it continuously for 2-3 weeks or longer, which means that you'll feel withdrawal symptoms if you stop taking it. You can avoid withdrawal by weaning off of the medication very slowly with the help of a doctor. Take only the prescribed dose. People with a history of drug abuse shouldn't take Morphine if an alternative medicine is available.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Morphine lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.
risk_factors: Taking other medicines that make you less alert

description_processed.orig: Morphine lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.

risks_warnings.title: Low blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Morphine can lower your blood pressure. You may feel dizzy, lightheaded. If you're sensitive to low blood pressure, change position slowly, such as going from sitting to standing since that is when you will feel the low blood pressure the most. If symptoms continues for more than a few doses, another pain medicine may be better for you.

description_processed.orig: Morphine can lower your blood pressure. You may feel dizzy, lightheaded. If you're sensitive to low blood pressure, change position slowly, such as going from sitting to standing since that is when you will feel the low blood pressure the most. If symptoms continues for more than a few doses, another pain medicine may be better for you.

carousel_items: Shake the eye drops well before using.
Press your finger gently on the inner corner of your eye after the drops are in to keep them there.
Wait 1 minute between each drop if you're giving yourself more than 1 drop.
If you have other eye drops, wait 5 minutes in between different sets of eye drops.
If your symptoms don't get better after 2 days, you may need to try a different medicine.
Let your doctor know if you have eye pain, pressure, infections, or changes in eye sight.

basics.benefits_moa: Prednisolone is a steroid that lowers your immune response to allergens and reduces eye redness and swelling.
basics.bottom_line: Prednisolone is strong medicine for eye redness and swelling without exposing the rest of your body to the steroid medicine.
downsides: Available only as a prescription medication.
You need good hand-eye coordination to get the eye drops into your eyes.
Can cause or worsen certain eye conditions.

downsides_processed.orig: Available only as a prescription medication.
You need good hand-eye coordination to get the eye drops into your eyes.
Can cause or worsen certain eye conditions.

upsides: Decreases swelling and redness in your eyes.
Doesn't cause the same types of side effects that oral forms of steroids do.

upsides_processed.orig: Decreases swelling and redness in your eyes.
Doesn't cause the same types of side effects that oral forms of steroids do.

userStories.tip: Effects on bone density, weight loss, bruising, thinning of the skin.

drugs.name: Prednisolone

carousel_items_processed.orig: Shake the eye drops well before using.
Press your finger gently on the inner corner of your eye after the drops are in to keep them there.
Wait 1 minute between each drop if you're giving yourself more than 1 drop.
If you have other eye drops, wait 5 minutes in between different sets of eye drops.
If your symptoms don't get better after 2 days, you may need to try a different medicine.
Let your doctor know if you have eye pain, pressure, infections, or changes in eye sight.

risks_warnings.title: Cataracts
risks_warnings.description: Prednisolone can increase your risk of developing cataracts. If you need to be on this medicine long term, get your eyes checked before starting and routinely while using it. Let your doctor know about any changes in your eyesight.

description_processed.orig: Prednisolone can increase your risk of developing cataracts. If you need to be on this medicine long term, get your eyes checked before starting and routinely while using it. Let your doctor know about any changes in your eyesight.

risks_warnings.title: Cornea hole
risks_warnings.description: Prednisolone can thin the lining in your eyes. Use it for the shortest time possible to avoid these side effects.

description_processed.orig: Prednisolone can thin the lining in your eyes. Use it for the shortest time possible to avoid these side effects.

risks_warnings.title: Glaucoma
risks_warnings.description: Long-term use of eye steroids like Prednisolone can increase eye pressure, damage eye nerves, or cause glaucoma. Let your doctor know about any eye pain, eye pressure, or changes in vision.

description_processed.orig: Long-term use of eye steroids like Prednisolone can increase eye pressure, damage eye nerves, or cause glaucoma. Let your doctor know about any eye pain, eye pressure, or changes in vision.

risks_warnings.title: Infections in your eyes
risks_warnings.description: Extended use of corticosteroids can lessen your body's immune response and make you more likely to get an infection. Let your doctor know if you have repeated eye infections, eye discharge, redness, or pain that won't go away.

description_processed.orig: Extended use of corticosteroids can lessen your body's immune response and make you more likely to get an infection. Let your doctor know if you have repeated eye infections, eye discharge, redness, or pain that won't go away.

carousel_items: Takes about 30 minutes to start working and can last about 4 to 6 hours.
Can cause stomach ulcers or bleeding. Don't take it with other blood-thinning medicines without talking to your doctor first.
Can cause headaches. If the headaches continue even after you take a lower dose, talk to your doctor about stopping Indomethacin.
The long-acting capsules must be swallowed whole. Don't crush them.
Take with food or milk to help prevent upset stomach.

basics.benefits_moa: Indomethacin is a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID). It blocks the inflammation process in your body, which relieves swelling and pain.
basics.bottom_line: Indomethacin works well for mild to moderate pain and swelling, but it shouldn't be used long-term since it has some serious side effects.
downsides: Indomethacin can cause serious heart and stomach problems. The risk goes up the longer you take it, but problems can happen at any time. Don't take Indomethacin any longer than your doctor recommends.
Indomethacin raises your risk of bleeding, especially when taken with other blood-thinning medicines.
There are similar medicines that you don't have to take as often and can work just as well.
Not a good choice if you have kidney, liver, or stomach problems.

downsides_processed.orig: Indomethacin can cause serious heart and stomach problems. The risk goes up the longer you take it, but problems can happen at any time. Don't take Indomethacin any longer than your doctor recommends.
Indomethacin raises your risk of bleeding, especially when taken with other blood-thinning medicines.
There are similar medicines that you don't have to take as often and can work just as well.
Not a good choice if you have kidney, liver, or stomach problems.

upsides: Effective option to relieve mild to moderate pain and swelling.
Treats inflammation problems, such as rheumatoid arthritis, osteoarthritis, and acute gout attacks.
In studies, Indomethacin was more effective than Tylenol for treating osteoarthritis pain.
It works as well as Celebrex for treating an acute gout attacks.
Available in capsules, long-acting capsules, suppositories, and as a suspension. All forms, except the suspension, are available as generic medications.

upsides_processed.orig: Effective option to relieve mild to moderate pain and swelling.
Treats inflammation problems, such as rheumatoid arthritis, osteoarthritis, and acute gout attacks.
In studies, Indomethacin was more effective than Tylenol for treating osteoarthritis pain.
It works as well as Celebrex for treating an acute gout attacks.
Available in capsules, long-acting capsules, suppositories, and as a suspension. All forms, except the suspension, are available as generic medications.

userStories.tip: They aren't judging when they say it can make you suck to your stomach. Spent the night on the bathroom floor a couple hours after taking it.

drugs.name: Indocin

carousel_items_processed.orig: Takes about 30 minutes to start working and can last about 4 to 6 hours.
Can cause stomach ulcers or bleeding. Don't take it with other blood-thinning medicines without talking to your doctor first.
Can cause headaches. If the headaches continue even after you take a lower dose, talk to your doctor about stopping Indomethacin.
The long-acting capsules must be swallowed whole. Don't crush them.
Take with food or milk to help prevent upset stomach.

risks_warnings.title: Heart attack or stroke
risks_warnings.description: Indomethacin can increase your chance of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke. The risk can increase the longer you take it. Talk to your doctor about taking the lowest dose that works for you for the shortest time possible.

description_processed.orig: Indomethacin can increase your chance of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke. The risk can increase the longer you take it. Talk to your doctor about taking the lowest dose that works for you for the shortest time possible.

risks_warnings.title: Stomach bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Indomethacin can cause serious stomach problems, such as ulcers, bleeding, and holes in the stomach or intestines. These problems can be life-threatening and can cause death. The risk can increase the longer you take it, but it can happen at any time. Watch out for blood or dark-colored stools. This can be a medical emergency and you should get help right away.
risk_factors: History of stomach bleeding or ulcers

description_processed.orig: Indomethacin can cause serious stomach problems, such as ulcers, bleeding, and holes in the stomach or intestines. These problems can be life-threatening and can cause death. The risk can increase the longer you take it, but it can happen at any time. Watch out for blood or dark-colored stools. This can be a medical emergency and you should get help right away.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Indomethacin may cause birth defects. Don't use Indomethacin while pregnant. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

description_processed.orig: Indomethacin may cause birth defects. Don't use Indomethacin while pregnant. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Indomethacin can cause serious allergic reactions.  These reactions can make it difficult to breath or cause a severe rash that can be life threatening. If you have Asthma, don't take Indomethacin if you're experiencing a runny nose (Rhinitis) with or without nasal polyps.  Also, don't take Indomethacin if you've experienced an asthma attack after taking aspirin or other NSAID type medications.  Stop taking Indomethacin and report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor right away.

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Indomethacin can cause serious allergic reactions.  These reactions can make it difficult to breath or cause a severe rash that can be life threatening. If you have Asthma, don't take Indomethacin if you're experiencing a runny nose (Rhinitis) with or without nasal polyps.  Also, don't take Indomethacin if you've experienced an asthma attack after taking aspirin or other NSAID type medications.  Stop taking Indomethacin and report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor right away.

risks_warnings.title: Worsening kidney or liver function
risks_warnings.description: Indomethacin is processed by the kidney and liver. If you have kidney or liver problems, talk to your doctor because you may need a different dose. (No dose adjustments are specified on the manufacturer's label.)

description_processed.orig: Indomethacin is processed by the kidney and liver. If you have kidney or liver problems, talk to your doctor because you may need a different dose. (No dose adjustments are specified on the manufacturer's label.)

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems due to high potassium
risks_warnings.description: Indomethacin can increase the amount of potassium in your body. High potassium can cause heart problems. Baseline and follow-up lab tests are needed before starting Indomethacin.

description_processed.orig: Indomethacin can increase the amount of potassium in your body. High potassium can cause heart problems. Baseline and follow-up lab tests are needed before starting Indomethacin.

risks_warnings.title: Bleeding or bruising
risks_warnings.description: You can bleed or bruise more easily while taking Indomethacin. Tell your doctor about any medicines you are taking or any health conditions before starting Indomethacin. If you take blood-thinning medicines, don't take Indomethacin without talking to your doctor first.

description_processed.orig: You can bleed or bruise more easily while taking Indomethacin. Tell your doctor about any medicines you are taking or any health conditions before starting Indomethacin. If you take blood-thinning medicines, don't take Indomethacin without talking to your doctor first.

carousel_items: If taking Diclofenac sodium by mouth, take it with a meal or a snack to prevent an upset stomach.
Can cause stomach ulcers, especially if taking it by mouth often.
Can make you bruise or bleed more easily. You shouldn't take any other 'blood thinner' medications unless your doctor tells you it's safe.
Don't use it the first two weeks after a heart surgery.
Can affect your kidneys' ability to work as well.

If using the skin (topical) gel, use the dosing card it comes with to make sure you measure the correct dose. You also won't have many of the same side effects that you would if taking Diclofenac sodium by mouth.

basics.benefits_moa: Diclofenac sodium is a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID). It blocks the inflammation process in your body, which relieves swelling and pain.
basics.bottom_line: Diclofenac sodium works well for pain and causes less upset stomach than other NSAIDs.
downsides: Can cause serious stomach problems like inflammation, ulcers, and bleeding. The chances that a stomach problem will occur is worse the longer you take this medication, but it can happen at any time while taking it.
Like all NSAIDs, it can raise your risk of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke.
Can lower kidney function or cause permanent kidney damage. These problems are more likely the longer you take it.

downsides_processed.orig: Can cause serious stomach problems like inflammation, ulcers, and bleeding. The chances that a stomach problem will occur is worse the longer you take this medication, but it can happen at any time while taking it.
Like all NSAIDs, it can raise your risk of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke.
Can lower kidney function or cause permanent kidney damage. These problems are more likely the longer you take it.

upsides: Works well to relieve pain and inflammation from osteoarthritis and rheumatoid arthritis.
Good for muscle aches and pains.
May treat arthritis pain better than other similar medicines (NSAIDs).
Can cause less upset stomach than other NSAIDs like ibuprofen (Advil).
It's also available as a gel that you put on your skin. If it's hard for you to swallow pills, this could be a good option.
If you're only using the gel, you won't have the same side effects that you would while taking Diclofenac sodium by mouth.

upsides_processed.orig: Works well to relieve pain and inflammation from osteoarthritis and rheumatoid arthritis.
Good for muscle aches and pains.
May treat arthritis pain better than other similar medicines (NSAIDs).
Can cause less upset stomach than other NSAIDs like ibuprofen (Advil).
It's also available as a gel that you put on your skin. If it's hard for you to swallow pills, this could be a good option.
If you're only using the gel, you won't have the same side effects that you would while taking Diclofenac sodium by mouth.

userStories.tip: Took Diclofenac SOD for CPPD (Inflammatory arthritis) for yrs before bilateral knee replacements. 3yrs later, I'm having swelling/pain after golf/long walks/workouts.  Meloxicam didn't help so asked for Diclofenac.  It still works for me!

userStories.identifier: Male with occasionally severe back pain
userStories.tip: My doctor prescribed Voltaren because he has completely undue fears of VicoProfen, but while VicoProfen works exceptionally well, Voltaren has no detectable effect on my pain.
If you feel dizzy, bring it up to your doctor.  Mine lowered the dosage and it helped a lot!

drugs.name: Voltaren

carousel_items_processed.orig: If taking Diclofenac sodium by mouth, take it with a meal or a snack to prevent an upset stomach.
Can cause stomach ulcers, especially if taking it by mouth often.
Can make you bruise or bleed more easily. You shouldn't take any other 'blood thinner' medications unless your doctor tells you it's safe.
Don't use it the first two weeks after a heart surgery.
Can affect your kidneys' ability to work as well.

If using the skin (topical) gel, use the dosing card it comes with to make sure you measure the correct dose. You also won't have many of the same side effects that you would if taking Diclofenac sodium by mouth.

risks_warnings.title: Heart attack or stroke
risks_warnings.description: Diclofenac sodium can increase your chance of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke. Take the lowest dose for the shortest time possible to lower your risk. Never take Diclofenac sodium during the first two weeks after having heart surgery.

description_processed.orig: Diclofenac sodium can increase your chance of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke. Take the lowest dose for the shortest time possible to lower your risk. Never take Diclofenac sodium during the first two weeks after having heart surgery.

risks_warnings.title: Stomach bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Diclofenac sodium can cause serious stomach problems that include inflammation, ulcers, bleeding, and holes in the stomach or intestines. The chances that a stomach problem will occur is worse the longer you take this medication, but it can happen at any time.
risk_factors: History of stomach bleeding or ulcers

description_processed.orig: Diclofenac sodium can cause serious stomach problems that include inflammation, ulcers, bleeding, and holes in the stomach or intestines. The chances that a stomach problem will occur is worse the longer you take this medication, but it can happen at any time.

risks_warnings.title: Bruising or bleeding
risks_warnings.description: You can bruise more easily while using Diclofenac sodium. If you're bleeding, it can take longer than normal for the bleeding to stop. Tell your doctor about all of your medical conditions and medications before starting Diclofenac sodium. Don't take Diclofenac sodium while using other blood thinning medications unless your doctor tells you it is safe.

description_processed.orig: You can bruise more easily while using Diclofenac sodium. If you're bleeding, it can take longer than normal for the bleeding to stop. Tell your doctor about all of your medical conditions and medications before starting Diclofenac sodium. Don't take Diclofenac sodium while using other blood thinning medications unless your doctor tells you it is safe.

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Diclofenac sodium can cause serious allergic reactions. These reactions can make it difficult to breath or cause a severe rash that can be life-threatening. Stop taking Diclofenac sodium and report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor or get medical help right away.

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Diclofenac sodium can cause serious allergic reactions. These reactions can make it difficult to breath or cause a severe rash that can be life-threatening. Stop taking Diclofenac sodium and report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor or get medical help right away.

risks_warnings.title: Lowers kidney function
risks_warnings.description: Diclofenac sodium, and similar medications in the NSAID family, can lower kidney function or cause permanent kidney damage. Taking the lowest dose for the shortest amount of time necessary can lower your risk of kidney problems. It's important to get lab tests to check your kidney function periodically if you use Diclofenac sodium for long periods of time.
risk_factors: Taking ACE inhibitors or angiotensin receptor blockers (ARBs)

description_processed.orig: Diclofenac sodium, and similar medications in the NSAID family, can lower kidney function or cause permanent kidney damage. Taking the lowest dose for the shortest amount of time necessary can lower your risk of kidney problems. It's important to get lab tests to check your kidney function periodically if you use Diclofenac sodium for long periods of time.

risks_warnings.title: Increased blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Diclofenac sodium can raise your blood pressure.  Most people usually don't feel any differently when their blood pressure is high, so check your blood pressure periodically to watch out for it. If you have high blood pressure and need a medication for the long-term treatment of pain, talk with your doctor since a different medication may be better for you.

description_processed.orig: Diclofenac sodium can raise your blood pressure.  Most people usually don't feel any differently when their blood pressure is high, so check your blood pressure periodically to watch out for it. If you have high blood pressure and need a medication for the long-term treatment of pain, talk with your doctor since a different medication may be better for you.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to unborn babies
risks_warnings.description: If you're in the late stages of pregnancy (more than 30 weeks), taking Diclofenac sodium can increase the risk of a heart defect in your baby. Talk with your doctor before using this medication while pregnant.

description_processed.orig: If you're in the late stages of pregnancy (more than 30 weeks), taking Diclofenac sodium can increase the risk of a heart defect in your baby. Talk with your doctor before using this medication while pregnant.
